User: It is still running, but received an error. jesse@DESKTOP-13JMJ93 MINGW64 /c/AI-Execution-System/deployment (temp-orphan) $ ./universal-deploy-script.sh --project ai-execution-system --region us-central1 --type run Enabling required GCP services... Deploying to Cloud Run... Building container image... ERROR: (gcloud.builds.submit) Invalid value for [source]: Dockerfile required when specifying --tag Deploying to Cloud Run... Deploying container to Cloud Run service [ai-execution-system-core] in project [ai-execution-system] region [us-central1]   -  Creating Revision...   .  Routing traffic...   OK Setting IAM Policy...

Gemini: gcloud builds submit is looking for Dockerfile in the WRONG PLACE. By default, when you run gcloud builds submit without specifying a source directory, it expects the Dockerfile to be in the current directory where you are running the command.
You are running universal-deploy-script.sh from C:\AI-Execution-System\deployment\ directory.
Your Dockerfile is located in C:\AI-Execution-System\deployment\terraform\ directory. (which is correct).
The FIX is to tell gcloud builds submit to look for the Dockerfile in the terraform subdirectory!

You need to EDIT universal-deploy-script.sh and make this change:

Open universal-deploy-script.sh in a text editor. (The one in C:\AI-Execution-System\deployment\)

Find this line in the script (it's in the elif [[ "$DEPLOYMENT_TYPE" == "run" ]] block, around line 80):

gcloud builds submit --tag gcr.io/$PROJECT_ID/$SERVICE_NAME
MODIFY this line to INCLUDE terraform as the source directory for the build:

gcloud builds submit terraform --tag gcr.io/$PROJECT_ID/$SERVICE_NAME
(Just add terraform before --tag). This tells gcloud builds submit: "The source code and Dockerfile for the build are located in the terraform subdirectory."

SAVE the modified universal-deploy-script.sh file.

After making this change in universal-deploy-script.sh:

Run the universal-deploy-script.sh command AGAIN from C:\AI-Execution-System\deployment\:

./universal-deploy-script.sh --project ai-execution-system --region us-central1 --type run
WATCH THE OUTPUT CAREFULLY again!

With this change, gcloud builds submit should now correctly find the Dockerfile in the terraform subdirectory, and the Docker image build process should be able to proceed!

Please EDIT universal-deploy-script.sh, make the change to the gcloud builds submit line, save the script, and then re-run ./universal-deploy-script.sh ... Let me know the EXACT OUTPUT after making this change!

We are SO CLOSE to getting past this Docker build error! This is a very targeted fix! LFG! Let's get this running!
